actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to protect the national security and economic well-being (including the Nation's present supplies and undeveloped sources of energy, fuel, food, and fiber) from damage due to arbitrary or unsound regulations, orders, or decisions issued by executive departments, agencies, and commissions.

summary.text: Authorizes the President to set aside for as long as he deems necessary, any Federal agency rule or regulation which he determines: (1) may be harmful to human life; (2) may restrict the Nation's supplies of fuel or energy resources; (3) may threaten the Nation's supplies of food and fiber; (4) may interfere with military maneuvers or national security; or (5) may have an adverse effect on the Nation's economy disproportionate to the ecological benefits of such rule or regulation. Permits Congress to disapprove such presidential action within 30 days after it is taken.

titles.title: A bill to protect the national security and economic well-being (including the Nation's present supplies and undeveloped sources of energy, fuel, food, and fiber) from damage due to arbitrary or unsound regulations, orders, or decisions issued by executive departments, agencies, and commissions.
